intro: Perrottetia simplicissima, commonly known as the white perrottetia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
